subject: AI
title: The RAG Pipeline
description: End-to-end flow from user question to grounded answer.

hook.text: RAG sounds simple until you build it. There are five moving parts, and each one can break independently.

buildup.text: The pipeline: (1) Ingest documents, (2) Chunk them, (3) Embed chunks into vectors, (4) At query time, embed the question and search for similar chunks, (5) Feed retrieved chunks + question to the LLM.

discovery.text: Each step has its own failure mode: bad chunks â†’ irrelevant retrieval. Bad embeddings â†’ semantic mismatches. Bad prompting â†’ the model ignores the context.

twist.text: Most RAG failures aren't in the LLM â€” they're in retrieval. If the right document isn't retrieved, the model can't use it. Garbage in, hallucination out.

climax.text: Debug RAG from retrieval backward: first check if the right chunks are being retrieved. Only then look at the LLM's behavior.

punchline.text: Five steps, five failure points. Debug from retrieval, not from the answer.

quiz.question: Where do most RAG failures originate?
options: In the retrieval step â€” the right documents aren't found
